newsitem.title: USA: Riddell Sports to sell $100 mln junk bonds.
newsitem.headline: Riddell Sports to sell $100 mln junk bonds.

text.p: Riddell Sports Inc plans to sell $100 million in 10-year senior notes in order to finance its acquisition of Varsity Spirit Corp, according to a confidential prospectus on the offering.
NationsBanc Capital Markets Inc and First Chicago Capital Markets Inc will underwrite the 144a private placement.
The company is also expected to enter into a $40 million five-year revolving credit facilty with NBD Bank and NationsBank Corp, according to the prospectus.
Net proceeds from the debt offering as well as the revolving credit facility will be used to finance the Varsity acquisition as well as to refinance an existing credit agreement.
On May 5, Ridell signed an agreement to purchase all the outstanding common stock of Varsity for $18.90 a share.
Riddell, headquartered in New York, is a leading manufacturer of football helmets and other athletic equipment.
Varsity is a Memphis, Tennessee-based maker of cheerleading and dance uniforms.
